content: the dave beanie by leanne wilkinson have a picky male in your life this hat is the product of many trial and error knit hats for my husband dave give it a whirl and rest easy knowing you ve found the one note about beanie length my dave doesn t like hats that completely cover his ears i told you he was picky so in the pattern i start the decreases at 5 5 from the cast on edge if you think your recipient would prefer covered lobes just continue in the round until 6-6 25 from the cast on edge before starting the decrease rounds for the top for the snug fitting beanie version pictured to the left simply knit the pattern as written on page 2 to modify for a slouchy version pictured to the right cast on 88 sts and join in the round and work in k2 p2 or k1 p1 using us 7s for 1 75 from the cast on edge stay with the 88sts but switch to larger needles us 8s and knit every round until hat measures 8 5 from cast on edge work dave beanie decreases on page 2 for the crown hat measures a wee bit over 10-inches from cast on edge to the very top measured lying flat size to fit a man s or woman s 22-23 head gauge 20sts over 4 using larger needle materials us 7/4 5mm circular needle 16 us 8/5 0mm circular needle 16 or needle size you need to get 20sts over 4 gauge us 8 dpns worsted weight yarn stitch marker to mark beginning of the round tapestry needle to weave in ends with the smaller needles us 7s cast on 88 sts and join for working in the round knit 2 purl 2 every round for an inch then switch to your larger needle us 8s and knit all stitches for one round then on the next round increase 8sts around by *k9 k1f&b repeat from* then knit the last 8 sts total stitches should now be 96 continue to knit every round perhaps throw in a couple of different coloured stripes if you re feeling crazy otherwise knit until hat measures 5½ inches see note about length on pg 1 from cast on edge then work decrease sequence as follows switching to the dpns when necessary decrease rounds for the crown round 1 - *knit 6 k2tog* repeat from * to the end of the round round 2 - knit round 3 - *knit 5 k2tog* repeat from * to the end of the round round 4 - knit round 5 - *knit 4 k2tog* repeat from * to the end of the round round 6 - knit round 7 - *knit 3 k2tog* repeat from * to the end of the round round 8 - knit round 9 - *knit 2 k2tog* repeat from * to the end of
